intro: Vaccinium bulleyanum, commonly known as the Bulleyan blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically blue or purple in color, with a tart flavor. It thrives in acidic soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
